#summary deleteAll([where,include,parameterize,instantiate])
#labels api,1.0

*Category*:

[ModelClassFunctions Model Class Functions]

*Description*:

Deletes all records that match the where argument. By default objects will not be instantiated and therefore callbacks and validations are not invoked. You can change this behavior by passing in instantiate=true. Returns the number of records that were deleted.

*Return Type*:

Numeric

*History*:

-

*Parameters*:

|| *Name* || *Type* || *Required* || *Default* || *Description* ||
|| *where* || numeric, string or list || true || - || See documentation for `findAll` ||
|| *include* || numeric, string or list || true || - || See documentation for `findAll` ||
|| *parameterize* || numeric, string or list || true || - || See documentation for `findAll` ||
|| *instantiate* || numeric, string or list || true || - || Whether or not to instantiate the object(s) before deletion ||

*Examples*:

{{{
<cfset recordsDeleted = model("user").deleteAll(where="inactive=1", instantiate=false)>
}}}
